intro: Gynura malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca gynura, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
